translated: Your child is already dead. I will give you a dāṇḍaka as your husband, so that you will have a child again, and then I will let you go.'
At that time, the mother then kowtowed and said:

original: 『我兒已死，聽各和解，我不用此餓婆羅門用作夫也。
analyzed: 『我兒已死，聽各和解，我不用此餓婆羅門用作夫也。
translated: 'My child is already dead. I agree to each of us being forgiven. I do not want this starving brāhman to be my husband.'
Then each of them understood and was forgiven.
The weaver's son then went before the king and said:
This man is violent and has trampled my father to death.
The king asked:
Why did you unjustly kill his father?
Tannin said:

original: 『眾債逼我，我甚惶怖，趒牆逃走，偶墮其上，實非所樂。
analyzed: 『眾債逼我，我甚惶怖，趒牆逃走，偶墮其上，實非所樂。
translated: Many debts pressed upon me, I was extremely frightened, I jumped over the wall to escape, and accidentally fell on him, it was truly not what I wanted.
The king said to the man:

original: 『二俱不是，卿父已死，以檀膩䩭，與汝作公。
analyzed: 『二俱不是，卿父已死，以檀膩䩭，與汝作公。
translated: Both of you are not at fault, your father is already dead, I will give Tannin to you as your father.
The man said to the king:

original: 『父已死了，我終不用此婆羅門以為父也。
analyzed: 『父已死了，我終不用此婆羅門以為父也。
translated: My father is already dead, I will never use this brahmin as my father.
Allowing them to each explain themselves, the king listened.

original: 「時檀膩䩭，身事都了，欣踊無量，故在王前。
analyzed: 「時檀膩䩭，身事都了，欣踊無量，故在王前。
translated: At that time, Tannin's affairs were all finished, he was overjoyed beyond measure, and so he was in front of the king.

original: 見二母人，共諍一兒，詣王相言。
analyzed: 見二母人，共諍一兒，詣王相言。
translated: He saw two women arguing over a child, and they went to the king to speak to each other.

original: 時王明黠，以智權計，語二母言：
analyzed: 時王明黠，以智權計，語二母言：
translated: At that time, the wise king, with his wise and expedient plans, said to the two women:

original: 『今唯一兒，二母召之，聽汝二人，各挽一手，誰能得者，即是其兒。🔽』其非母者，於兒無慈，盡力頓牽，不恐傷損；
analyzed: 『今唯一兒，二母召之，聽汝二人，各挽一手，誰能得者，即是其兒。 』其非母者，於兒無慈，盡力頓牽，不恐傷損；
translated: 'Now there is only one child, and two mothers are calling for him. I will let you two each pull one hand, and whoever can get him is his mother.🔽' The one who is not the mother has no compassion for the child and pulls with all her might, not afraid of hurting him;

original: 所生母者，於兒慈深，隨從愛護，不忍抴挽。
analyzed: 所生母者，於兒慈深，隨從愛護，不忍抴挽。
translated: The one who gave birth to him has deep love for the child and follows along protecting him, unable to bear pulling him.
The king sees the truth and falsehood and tells the one who exerts force:

original: 『實非汝子，強挽他兒，今於王前，道汝事實。
analyzed: 『實非汝子，強挽他兒，今於王前，道汝事實。
translated: 'He is really not your son, yet you forcefully pull another's child. Now in front of the king, tell the truth.
' He then faces the king and says:
'I am indeed false and wrongly call another's child mine.
Great king, you are wise and holy!
Please forgive my false transgression.
' The child returns to his mother and they are each released.

original: 復有二人，共諍白󰧕，詣王紛紜，王復以智，如上斷之。
analyzed: 復有二人，共諍白󰧕，詣王紛紜，王復以智，如上斷之。
translated: There were also two people who argued over a white conch. They went to the king in confusion. The king again used his wisdom to resolve it as above.
At that time, Dhaniṅkara then said to the king:

original: 『此諸債主，將我來時，於彼道邊，有一毒蛇，慇懃倩我，寄意白王：
analyzed: 『此諸債主，將我來時，於彼道邊，有一毒蛇，慇懃倩我，寄意白王：
translated: 'When these creditors were taking me away, by the side of the road there was a poisonous snake, who earnestly entrusted me with a message to tell the king:

original: 「不知何故，從穴出時，柔軟便易，還入穴時，妨礙苦痛，我不自知何緣有是？
analyzed: 「不知何故，從穴出時，柔軟便易，還入穴時，妨礙苦痛，我不自知何緣有是？
translated: I do not know why when coming out of the hole it is soft and easy, but when entering the hole it is obstructed and painful. I do not know myself why this is so?'
The king replied,

original: 『所以然者，從穴出時，無有眾惱，心情和柔，身亦如是。
analyzed: 『所以然者，從穴出時，無有眾惱，心情和柔，身亦如是。
translated: 'The reason is that when coming out of the hole, there are no afflictions, the mind is harmonious and soft, and the body is also like that.

original: 蛇由在外，鳥獸諸事，觸嬈其身，瞋恚隆盛，身便麤大，是以入時，礙穴難前。
analyzed: 蛇由在外，鳥獸諸事，觸嬈其身，瞋恚隆盛，身便麤大，是以入時，礙穴難前。
translated: Because the snake is outside, birds and beasts touch its body with various things, and its anger swells, so the body becomes coarse and large. Therefore, when entering, it is obstructed and difficult to proceed in the hole.
You should tell it:

original: 「若汝在外，持心不瞋，如初出時則無此患。
analyzed: 「若汝在外，持心不瞋，如初出時則無此患。
translated: If you hold your mind without anger outside, like when first coming out, then there will be no such trouble.
' He further said to the king:

'On the way I saw a woman who entrusted me with a message to tell the king:🔽I do not know why when I first came out of the hole, my body was soft and easy, but now when I enter the hole, it is obstructed and painful. I do not know myself why this is so.

original: 「我在夫家，念父母舍，若在父舍，復念夫家，不知所以何緣乃爾？
analyzed: 「我在夫家，念父母舍，若在父舍，復念夫家，不知所以何緣乃爾？
translated: When I am in my husband's house, I think of my parents' home. When I am in my parents' home, I think of my husband's house. I do not know why this is so.
The king replied:
'You should tell her:

original: 「由汝邪心，於父母舍更畜傍婿，汝在夫家念彼傍人；
analyzed: 「由汝邪心，於父母舍更畜傍婿，汝在夫家念彼傍人；
translated: It is because of your evil mind, keeping a secret lover in your parents' home, that you think of him when you are in your husband's house;

original: 至彼小厭，還念正婿，是以爾耳。
analyzed: 至彼小厭，還念正婿，是以爾耳。
translated: when you are a little tired of him, you think of your husband again. This is why it is so.
You should tell her:

original: 「汝若持心，捨邪就正，則無此患。
analyzed: 「汝若持心，捨邪就正，則無此患。
translated: If you can abandon evil and return to the right, then this trouble will not happen.
' He also said to the king:

original: 『道邊樹上，見有一雉，倩我白王：
analyzed: 『道邊樹上，見有一雉，倩我白王：
translated: 'By the side of the road, on a tree, I saw a pheasant entrusting me to tell the king:

original: 「我在餘樹，鳴聲不好，若在此樹，鳴聲哀和，不知其故何緣如是？
analyzed: 「我在餘樹，鳴聲不好，若在此樹，鳴聲哀和，不知其故何緣如是？
translated: When I am on other trees, my cry is not good. When I am on this tree, my cry is mournful and harmonious. I do not know why it is so.
' The king told that person:

original: 『所以爾者，由彼樹下有大釜金，是以於上，鳴聲哀好；
analyzed: 『所以爾者，由彼樹下有大釜金，是以於上，鳴聲哀好；
translated: 'The reason is that under that tree there is a large cauldron of gold, and therefore the sound is so beautiful when struck;

original: 餘處無金，是以住上，音聲不好。
analyzed: 餘處無金，是以住上，音聲不好。
translated: other places do not have gold, and therefore the sound is not as good when struck.'
The king said to Tandi:

original: 『卿之多過，吾已釋汝，汝家貧窮困苦理極，樹下釜金，應是我有，就用與汝，卿可掘取。
analyzed: 『卿之多過，吾已釋汝，汝家貧窮困苦理極，樹下釜金，應是我有，就用與汝，卿可掘取。
translated: 'Because of your many offenses, I have already released you. Your family is poor and suffering to the extreme. The gold in the cauldron under the tree should belong to me, but I will give it to you. You can dig it up.'
He respectfully accepted the king's instructions and answered each one.

original: 掘取彼金，貿易田業，一切所須，皆無乏少，便為富人，盡世快樂。
analyzed: 掘取彼金，貿易田業，一切所須，皆無乏少，便為富人，盡世快樂。
translated: He dug up the gold and traded it for fields and businesses. Everything he needed was not lacking, and he became a wealthy person, enjoying happiness for the rest of his life.
The Buddha said to Ānanda:

original: 「爾時大王，阿婆羅提目佉者，豈異人乎？
analyzed: 「爾時大王，阿婆羅提目佉者，豈異人乎？
translated: Was the great king Apara-ti-mu-qiao at that time someone else?
It was I myself.

original: 爾時婆羅門檀膩䩭者，今婆羅門賓頭盧埵闍是。
analyzed: 爾時婆羅門檀膩䩭者，今婆羅門賓頭盧埵闍是。
translated: The brāhman Tandi at that time is now the brāhman Pi-tou-lu-tuo-sha.

original: 我往昔時，免其眾厄，施以珍寶，令其快樂；
analyzed: 我往昔時，免其眾厄，施以珍寶，令其快樂；
translated: In the past, I saved them from various calamities, gave them precious treasures, and brought them happiness;

original: 吾今成佛，復拔彼苦，施以無盡法藏寶財。
analyzed: 吾今成佛，復拔彼苦，施以無盡法藏寶財。
translated: Now that I have attained Buddhahood, I again rescue them from suffering and bestow upon them the inexhaustible treasure of the Dharma.

original: 」尊者阿難，及諸眾會，聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
analyzed: 」尊者阿難，及諸眾會，聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translated: The Venerable Ānanda and the assembly, upon hearing the Buddha's words, joyfully undertook to follow them.🔽Here is the corrected and aligned text:
The Sūtra of the Wise and the Foolish, Scroll 11
